name: My Mother's Tuna Salad
description: This is Julia Reed’s favorite tuna salad, the one she subsisted on for years as a child, eaten with a fork straight out of a container in her mother’s refrigerator. It’s an unfussy thing that is exactly suited to be layered between two pieces of white bread — toasted, if you must — and then eaten at the kitchen table, or, after summer ends, at the lunchroom table. The ingredients are simple and easily acquired, and be sure to use real mayonnaise.
keywords: main course, side dish, mayonnaise, tuna
recipeIngredient: 1 (12-ounce) can StarKist solid white albacore tuna in water
4 large ribs celery, peeled and finely chopped
3 tablespoons chopped sweet pickles, with their juice
1 teaspoon celery salt or more to taste
1 teaspoon McCormick Season-All or more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Drain the tuna, place it in a bowl and break it up with a fork. Add 1/4 cup of mayonnaise and blend well. Mix in the remaining ingredients, and add the rest of the mayonnaise. Check for celery salt, Season-All, salt and pepper. This is better if it sits at least one hour before serving.
